5. In order to ensure the widest possible distribution and sale
of the proposed listener guides and pamphlets overseas, t?t.r
would propose to make arrangements with the Macmillan Company
of New York for manufacturing and distribution. As exclusive
holder of the rights to the project developed materials, ELS
would propose to grant these rights to the Macmillan Company
to enable the Macmillan Company to secure copyright to the
materials. It is mutually agreed and understood that the
listener guides and pamphlets to be distributed and sold
overseas must be low-priced in the interest of the success
of the U.S.I.A. radio programs. Further, it is agreed that
the actual sale price of the listener guides and pamphlets
will be established in consultation with the N.A.E.B.
6. ELS proposes to complete the development of the required
prospectus and the sixty-five fifteen-minute radio scripts
within a period of four months following the effective
beginning date of the proposed contract with the N.A.E.B.
It is estimated that, following the completion of project
materials, an additional period of sixty days will be required
by the Macmillan Company for manufacturing and release of the
printed listener materials.
We have developed preliminary work plans and procedures for the developÂ¬
ment of the proposed materials and would be prepared to undertake the
project immediately upon award of contract.
Should you require additional details or clarification of our proposal,
I hope you will not hesitate to call me.
Sincerely,
